title: Caramel-Glazed Flan Recipe
description: More egg whites than yolks and low-fat sweetened condensed milk are the signature features of this altered flan.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Caramel-Glazed Flan 4.7 (119) 100 Reviews 8 Photos This is a reduced-fat version of this delicious Spanish origin dessert. I made it this way and my family did not notice the difference with the original fatty version. Good point! Submitted by Mogirimi Updated on July 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 15 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 - 9-inch round Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings ¾ cup white sugar 2 egg yolks 6 egg whites 1 ¾ cups water 1 (14 ounce) can low-fat sweetened condensed milk ½ teaspoon vanilla extract 1 pinch salt Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a heavy skillet over medium-low heat, cook and stir sugar until melted and light brown. Carefully pour into a 9-inch round baking dish, tilting the dish to coat the bottom completely. In a medium bowl, beat egg yolks and egg whites. Stir in water, condensed milk, vanilla and salt until smooth. Pour into prepared dish. Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel. Place baking dish on towel, inside roasting pan, and place roasting pan on oven rack. Fill roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sides of the baking dish. Bake in preheated oven 1 hour, until center is just set (still a bit jiggly). Remove dish to a wire rack to cool for one hour. Then refrigerate several hours or overnight. To unmold, run a knife around the edge of the pan and invert onto a rimmed serving platter. I Made It Print 120 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 327 Calories 4g Fat 60g Carbs 9g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 327 % Daily Value * Total Fat 4g 5% Saturated Fat 2g 11% Cholesterol 60mg 20% Sodium 114mg 5% Total Carbohydrate 60g 22% Total Sugars 59g Protein 9g 17% Calcium 183mg 14% Iron 0mg 1% Potassium 46mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Caramel-Glazed Flan 01 of 08 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 08 Photo by  Deb C 07/07/2019 This is creamy and smooth and a little lighter than other flans. I used eight ramekins for ease in serving and it worked out perfectly. 03 of 08 Photo by  kimbernic 05/15/2012 04 of 08 Photo by  harvard11111 12/04/2009 I surrounded the finished product with pomegranate and covered it with fresh fruit -- it was delicious and went over really well at a party. Thanks for the recipe! 05 of 08 Photo by  RMSR 06/10/2009 I made quite a few modifications to this recipe. I used regular sweetened condensed milk and used five whole eggs; next time I will use only four as the mixture was slightly overflowing. As per another reviewer's suggestion, I added some grated nutmeg and 1/4 cup orange liqueur (blue-label Grand Marnier; it would have been good to added in some orange zest. My guests found the sauce a little watery, and suggested I add some butter to the sugar while I melt it to get a nice and thick caramel consistency. My first time making flan, and it didn't crack in half! This is a good recipe, and I will continue to play around with it. EDIT(o6/21/o9): Adding butter to the sugar while melting may add more calories, but improves the taste and consistency of the caramel topping. 06 of 08 Photo by  Aredendra 02/05/2009 Tasty flan, really excellent for low-fat, but it didn't blow my mind. Tried almond extract instead of vanilla which was interesting, but I think I'll stick with vanilla next time. 07 of 08 Photo by  Allegra 02/06/2006 1 You’ll Also Love Creamy Caramel Flan 705 Ratings Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) 64 Ratings Super Easy Cream Cheese Flan 5 Ratings Coconut Flan 50 Ratings Coconut Milk Flan 17 Ratings Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan) 128 Ratings Microwave Flan 25 Ratings White Chocolate Flan 4 Ratings Baked Flan 514 Ratings Aracely's Flan 40 Ratings Pumpkin Flan Flan I 58 Ratings 7 Absolutely Irresistible Mexican Flan Recipes Coconut Cheese Flan (Flan de Coco y Queso) 47 Ratings Sous Vide Flan 12 Ratings Quesillo (Venezuelan Flan) 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Mogirimi
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;In a heavy skillet over medium-low heat, cook and stir sugar until melted and light brown. Carefully pour into a 9-inch round baking dish, tilting the dish to coat the bottom completely.;In a medium bowl, beat egg yolks and egg whites. Stir in water, condensed milk, vanilla and salt until smooth. Pour into prepared dish. Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel. Place baking dish on towel, inside roasting pan, and place roasting pan on oven rack. Fill roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sides of the baking dish.;Bake in preheated oven 1 hour, until center is just set (still a bit jiggly). Remove dish to a wire rack to cool for one hour. Then refrigerate several hours or overnight.;To unmold, run a knife around the edge of the pan and invert onto a rimmed serving platter.
